text: hi everyone anthony fantano here
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review
of the new megan the stallion album good
news
this is the debut full-length lp from
houston rap
superstar megan the stallion in the
matter of a year megan went from double
xl freshman to one of the most
talked about names in hip hop right now
and that's off hot mix tapes and eps
salacious music videos banging singles a
strong feature game
and the total and utter fiasco that was
born out of accusations
that tory lanez shot her there was also
the garbage
album he did but we don't need to talk
about that
during a pandemic that's ravaging entire
sectors of the music industry
megan's wave is showing itself to be
pretty covet proof
and given her pen game her talents on
the mic
her personality and ear for beats i went
into this new record hoping for it to be
but unfortunately good news has fallen
pretty short of that
not to say there aren't highlights on
this thing or that it didn't sound like
she was moving in a good direction to
start the record kicks off with shots
fired which of course is a response
to everything that transpired in regards
to
tory lanez and the shooting the drama
the fallout
all of it and it's a pretty brutal
smackdown set to the same sample that
colored biggies
who shot you a cold-blooded choice
structurally it doesn't really have a
strong hook or anything but megan gets
this drama
out of the way effectively telling her
side of the story in a compelling way
in order to make room for just the rest
of the record that i'm sure she's been
working on for a while
now what happens past this point on good
news is a bit of a mixed bag
i can tell that megan is trying to
branch out on this lp not thematically
but stylistically
first with some tunes and instrumentals
that are a bit more feel good and
inspiring
the track circles is packed with these
groovy upbeat rhythms and chipmunk
vocal samples honestly it sounds like
something drake would make a hit with
one of those life affirming anthems he
does megan's essentially working with
the same recipe here but with a bad
[ __ ] angle
then there's sugar baby which is colored
with these blurting
rigid synthesizer sequences that sound
like something out of an arcade game
honestly it works and adds to the
tongue-in-cheek humor of the song
which is basically a sugar baby anthem
where megan shows just how big
the price tag that comes with that can
be
there are also a few attempts at genre
crossovers on this thing too
and these end up being some of the
roughest moments on the record
don't rock me to sleep is a week week
weak dance pop jam with a bland
instrumental and the same terrible
singing that
ruined multiple tracks on megan's suga
ep
then intercourse is yet another bland
reverb dance hall number where the
main artist sounds like they're out of
their element plus popcon's chorus here
is kind of ridiculous
now of course there are songs in the
track list where megan
is going back to ideas that have worked
for her in the past
but even some of these tracks are not
all that great there's crybaby with
da baby who for some reason takes up
most of the song with the same
ass flow we've heard again and again
the track is also laced with these vocal
samples
a complete throwaway in my opinion then
there's body which is an ass shaker with
sexual moans being sampled left and
right a peppy trap beat
if anyone is going to do this formula
any justice it's megan
but god is that bad
yeah that hook is uh not
it really the whole song is packed with
some of megan's weakest
writing to date it seems like on this
cut she's just desperate to boil her
sound and style down to
two or three of the most obvious
characteristics ugh
i mean the flow is good but she's really
painting herself into
a corner pretty quickly here i'd say
she's doing that to
a degree on the song work that as well
especially with that
week a rad lagarrorio
lead vocal melody that's uh pretty rough
there are some key features on this
project i should mention too
do it on the tip featuring city girls
where the chemistry is
actually insane there might be a super
skeletal five dollar beat on this one
but it's got some nice bass
some good rhythm change-ups and the
simplicity allows the vocals to really
pop with one hilarious raunchy
dick bar after another movie also has
the makings of being one of the hardest
tracks here that chilling beat the flow
the asmr line the stretch to it line
but every time lil dirk pops up on this
track it's like the song just hits
the snooze button no enthusiasm or
attitude at all
there's also scizza on freaky girls who
is great her vocal lines really slice
through this chorus
in a way where it sounds like a modern
classic but honestly this is another
moment on the record that is pretty
underproduced the mix here is very thin
as well which is a
bit of an issue across multiple tracks
here there are just a lot of songs that
don't knock there's also go crazy
featuring big sean and two chains that
actually has a really interesting and
creative application of a jackson 5
sample
if you're not paying attention you might
not even catch it it's sampled and
incorporated in such a roundabout way
because on the surface it just sounds
like a zany banger with a tight baseline
and these
deflating tones thankfully 2chain's
over-the-top energy
and big sean's low-key charisma
complements the song really well
megan's hook is really simple but
effective her verse is fine too
this might not be one of her best tracks
ever but it's certainly one of the
better songs here
on the record then following this we
have a very curious final leg
where megan decides to throw the big
major
teasers to this lp all at the very end
the savage remix with beyonce girls in
the hood
the young thug track as well that
features some really experimental
production
almost sounds like something that would
come out of the pc music camp
and then there's outside which i see
spiritually to be the real closer of the
record
where megan drops a feel-good melodic
flow
over this synthy euphoric glistening
beat
and substantively the song is one of the
most intimate moments on the entire
record where megan
goes into a bit of an internal monologue
she is addressing the pressures of
being so in demand doing what she's
doing in the limelight until basically
she's tired of doing it
and just showing this ass cause it's
what they want to see
which in a way i think is acknowledging
that on this record
she's really just giving the audience
what she thinks they want
as opposed to branching out taking a
risk
doing something different i don't know
so i guess at the end of the day you
could say i liked the record it's decent
it's got some great highlights on it
here and there but
i still can't help but feel like this
thing is really
megan's selling herself short
artistically i think she has a lot more
potential than what she brought here
whether or not she's willing to grab
that potential
or just like she says on outside chase
after what she thinks her audience wants
of her and just merely do that
into the future remains to be seen i
guess feeling a light to decent six
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
